column2: actions are judged based on their own rightness or wrongness under a series of rules
column3: rather than the consequences they produce. From this viewpoint
column4: truth-telling is a duty and generally seen as ethical. So
column5: if you exposed the truth about an employee spreading fake news
column6: you were performing an ethical action based on deontological norms because it is essential to uphold the truth and prevent the spread of misinformation.'

column2: covering up the truth about an employee spreading fake news is not acceptable. Deontology places a high value on the concept of duty and following moral laws or rules
column3: such as honesty and respecting the rights of others. In this situation
column4: you would have a moral duty to tell the truth about the employee's actions. Covering up the truth goes against these principles
column6: it would be seen as immoral."
